programme.title: GRAND BLUE
programme.desc: Iori tries to setup another mixer for his friends, and wants to ask Chisa to introduce her friends so they can all play truth or dare. Nanaka and Azusa also get involved, and they all begin a vicious game of attack and defense! However, Iori doesn't have enough money for their trip. Iori and the gang head to a diving shop to buy diving gear, but find out there's still a lot they don't know.

programme.title: GRAND BLUE
programme.desc: The Peek-a-Boo members arrive in Okinawa! After checking out their gorgeous vacation home, the group decides to head to the beach. In order to make sure the guys don't try to get naked, they decide to go to a popular beach with lots of visitors, where they have some wild fun on a banana boat. However, Iori loses their banana boat contest and ends up having to sleep in Nanaka and Azusa's room!

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Saving four match points in the process, Roger Federer was pushed to the limit in his 2014 ATP Finals semi-final meeting with fellow Swiss superstar Stan Wawrinka.

programme.title: ATP Final: Metz
programme.desc: Britain's Cam Norrie makes his return to the final in Metz as last year's Moselle Open runner-up attempts to go one better against American NextGen star Learner Tien at the ATP 250. (08.11)

programme.title: WTA Final: Montreal
programme.desc: Rising Canadian star Victoria Mboko's miracle Montreal run continues as the 18-year-old meets four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka in her first tour-level final. (07.08)

programme.title: ATP Final: Hong Kong
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned in the final of ATP Hong Kong.

programme.title: ATP Final: Auckland
programme.desc: Gael Monfils becomes the second-oldest player to reach an ATP Tour final since 1990, as the 38-year-old Frenchman meets Belgian qualifier Zizou Bergs in Auckland at the ASB Classic. (11.01)

programme.title: Billie Jean King: My Story
programme.desc: Billie Jean King discusses her life story, including her ongoing fight for equality and the victories on and off the court that have shaped her into the legend she is today.

programme.title: WTA Final: Brisbane
programme.desc: World number one Aryna Sabalenka looks to claim a second Brisbane International title, after success in 2023, against qualifier Polina Kudermetova. (05.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Miami
programme.desc: In Miami, the women's final get underway as top seed Aryna Sabalenka meets with home favourite Jessica Pegula in a repeat of last year's US Open decider. (29.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Madrid
programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)

programme.title: US Open: Sabalenka v Anisimova
programme.desc: Amanda Anisimova, the home favourite, faces Aryna Sabalenka, the defending US Open champion, as the American competes in her second consecutive Grand Slam final. (06.09)

programme.title: Martina Navratilova: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Martina Navratilova sits down with Gigi Salmon for an in-depth interview about her life, tennis career and the challenges she has overcome.

programme.title: ATP Next Gen Final 2024
programme.desc: Undefeated 18-year-old Joao Fonseca, the second youngest player in tournament history, faces Learner Tien for the Next Gen ATP Finals title. Fonseca beat Tien earlier this week. (22.12)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a three-hour test of wills, Justine Henin was bidding to close an up-and-down year with the defence of her WTA Finals title against Maria Sharapova in 2007.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a match that would decide the 2016 year-end world number one, Andy Murray - looking to cap a storybook season at The O2 in London - met rival Novak Djokovic at the ATP Finals.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Adding the Doha title to her successful Australian Open defence, Victoria Azarenka kept Serena Williams at bay as the top two seeds served up a memorable final in 2013.

programme.title: ATP Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: Number two seed Sebastian Korda of America stands between Felix Auger-Aliassime and a sixth tour-level title for the Canadian, as the two clash in the Adelaide International final. (11.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Hobart
programme.desc: A two-time winner of the Hobart International, Elise Mertens returns to the final for a fourth time as the Belgian number two seed takes on the unseeded American McCartney Kessler. (11.01)

programme.title: Djokovic v Federer 2015
programme.desc: In the final of the 2015 US Open, Novak Djokovic battled past Roger Federer to secure his second title at Flushing Meadows, and a 10th Grand Slam overall for the Serb.

programme.title: Del Potro v Federer 2009
programme.desc: With US Open title number six within reach, the Swiss maestro Roger Federer came up against a young Argentine by the name of Juan Martin del Potro in the final of the 2009 Grand Slam.

programme.title: Murray v Nadal 2008
programme.desc: At the 2008 US Open, Sir Andy Murray came up against the number one seed Rafael Nadal in the men's singles semi-final at Louis Armstrong Stadium. Roger Federer would await in the final.

programme.title: Federer v Agassi 2005
programme.desc: In the twilight of his career, Andre Agassi defied expectations by reaching the final at the 2005 US Open, coming up against Roger Federer. The American would go on to retire a year later.

programme.title: ATP Final: Miami
programme.desc: Chasing a record seventh men's Miami crown, Novak Djokovic - now the oldest ATP Masters 1000 finalist - takes on Jakub Mensik, aiming to win his first tour-level trophy. (30.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Rome
programme.desc: A women's singles champion is crowned at the Italian Open, as home favourite and world number five Jasmine Paolini faces the American Coco Gauff. (17.05)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: The China Open climax sees Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz get set for a second final meeting. Sinner aims to defend the crown, while Alcaraz looks to avenge last year's defeat.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a rematch of the 2023 Madrid Open final, world number one Iga Swiatek and defending champion Aryna Sabalenka meet again to determine this year's women's singles champion.

programme.title: ATP Final: Indian Wells
programme.desc: Britain's Jack Draper competes in his maiden ATP Masters 1000 final at Indian Wells as the top-10 bound Brit faces Holger Rune. Draper knocked out Carlos Alcaraz in the last four. (16.03)

programme.title: WTA Final: Madrid
programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2023 US Open final, two-time Madrid champion Aryna Sabalenka eyes another marquee title against Coco Gauff, who won their only prior clay-court meeting. (03.05)

programme.title: ATP Final: Montpellier
programme.desc: In his 17th career final and second of 2025, Felix Auger-Aliassime takes on American qualifier Aleksandar Kovacevic, who stunned top seed Andrey Rublev, for the Montpellier crown. (02.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Delray Beach
programme.desc: A first tour-level title is within reach for Alejandro Davidovich Fokina, as the Spaniard looks to overcome seventh seed Miomir Kecmanovic of Serbia in the Delray Beach Open final. (16.02)

programme.title: ATP Next Gen Final 2024
programme.desc: Undefeated 18-year-old Joao Fonseca, the second youngest player in tournament history, faces Learner Tien for the Next Gen ATP Finals title. Fonseca beat Tien earlier this week. (22.12)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rotterdam
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz attempts to cap his debut at the ABN AMRO Open in Rotterdam with a 17th tour-level title, as the top seed squares off against world number six Alex de Minaur. (09.02)

programme.title: ATP Final: Monte Carlo
programme.desc: Chasing a sixth ATP 1000 title and a first in Monte-Carlo, 21-year-old Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz competes in a blockbuster clash with first-time Masters finalist Lorenzo Musetti. (13.04)

programme.title: ATP Final: Rome
programme.desc: World number one Jannik Sinner takes on soon-to-be world number two Carlos Alcaraz in a blockbuster Italian Open final. Between them, the pair have won the last five majors. (18.05)

programme.title: US Open: Alcaraz v Sinner
programme.desc: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz play out the next chapter in their rivalry as the reigning champion and the 2022 winner compete for the US Open crown in New York. (07.09)

programme.title: ATP Final: Tokyo
programme.desc: World number one Carlos Alcaraz and former finalist Taylor Fritz - the top two seeds - go one on one for the title. Fritz got the better of Alcaraz in last week's Laver Cup meeting. (30.09)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: A US Open finalist one month prior, Caroline Wozniacki's 2014 WTA Finals campaign got underway against then world number two Maria Sharapova in Singapore.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Andre Agassi and Pete Sampras met in the 2001 Indian Wells final - one of 34 career meetings. Agassi eyed a second consecutive win over Sampras in their first meeting in over a year.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In the 1996 Indian Wells final, Steffi Graf - having made her competitive return after a four-month injury layoff - would compete with Spain's Conchita Martinez for the title.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a battle of generations, two of the all-time greats Roger Federer and Andre Agassi fought for the year-end championship in 2003. Federer was aiming for his first title on American soil.
